medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient had a 2-month history of progressively worsening skin lesions, diagnosed 5 months earlier as pemphigus vulgaris, resulting in erosions and bullae. These were itchy and painful, associated with difficulty swallowing, anorexia, and a weight loss of 1.4 kg. One month later, he experienced hoarseness and a cough with yellow sputum for 1 week. At later follow-up, he reported new painful lesions on his back and burning with urination, along with persistent fatigue.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of diabetes mellitus, hypertension, and hyperlipidemia.
medical_history.family_history: Father died of stomach cancer at 69 years of age; mother died during childbirth. One of his eight children died of an 'immune problem'; no family history of skin diseases.
medical_history.social_history: Retired, lives with wife in New England. Stopped smoking 40 years ago after 5 pack-years. Does not drink alcohol or use illicit drugs. Travel history limited to Florida; no return to South America.
